Description: Reckitt Benckiser company disposed of approximately 15,000 pounds of product in the Prairie View Regional Sanitary Landfill. The product was over the shelf life or discontinued and considered a waste. Benckiser pled guilty to one count of violating RCRA.

NAICS Translation: 488490: Other Support Activities for Road Transportation

Description: Reckitt Benckiser Group agreed to pay $200 million to to resolve multistate litigation alleging that it improperly marketed its opioid addiction treatment drug Suboxone and thus caused false claims to be submitted to state Medicaid programs. This was part of a larger $1.4 billion civil and criminal settlement involving the U.S. Department of Justice, which issued its own announcement (see separate Violation Tracker entry).

Reckitt Benckiser Group agreed to pay $50 million to settle allegations that it violated the antitrust laws through a deceptive scheme to thwart lower-priced generic competition to its branded drug Suboxone.

Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC agreed to pay more than $1.3 billion to resolve its potential criminal and civil liability related to a federal investigation of the marketing of the opioid addiction treatment drug Suboxone.

Secondary Offense: off-label or unapproved promotion of medical products
Description: Reckitt Benckiser agreed to pay $400 million to state governments to resolve litigation involving improper marketing of the opioid addiction treatment drug Suboxone. This was part of a larger $1.3 billion criminal and civil settlement also involving the federal government; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-reckitt-benckiser-group-plc-0

Reckitt Benckiser, producer of Mucinex, agreed to pay more than $300,000 to the District Attorneys of Los Angeles, Sacramento and Shasta counties to resolve allegations it engaged in misleading packaging practices.
Info Source: Mucinex maker coughs up $300K to settle case, Sacramento Business Journal, December 19, 2008 (via Nexis).
